definition: to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
to cure by drying over a fire (tea, meat etc)/to bake
lit. to shade in the clouds to offset the moon (idiom); fig. a foil/a contrasting character to a main hero
to set off/to highlight by contrast
relief shading (in a picture)/fig. to throw into relief

sentences.chinese: 另外，你提供烘好的水果也是可以的。

sentences.english: You can get the toasted coconut from Thai grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 烘椰肉可在泰國雜貨店購買。

sentences.english: Broil, bake or poach it with dill
You need to know the amount of power your dryer consumes.
sentences.chinese: 你所需要知道的就是你的烘衣機消耗的電能是多少。

sentences.english: Grease the tin with butter before baking the cake.
sentences.chinese: 烘蛋糕之前先給白鐵器皿底部塗上一層黃油。

sentences.english: Roast some fresh beets for an eye-saving side dish.
sentences.chinese: 把烘甜菜根作爲眼睛治療食物。

sentences.english: Do you have any idea how much money it costs per hour to run an electric dryer?
sentences.chinese: 你知道電子的烘衣機每個小時要花費多少麼？

sentences.english: The food sure beat public school's mystery meatloaf.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的食物比公立學校的烘肉卷好多了。

sentences.english: Then turn the oven off and leave the cookies in for 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 讓餅乾繼續留在烤箱裏用餘溫烘20分鐘。

sentences.english: Baking varnish was gained by stoving the product at 150℃.
sentences.chinese: 產物經150℃烘烤可得烘於清漆。

sentences.english: Oh, I gotta tell you. I made your cajun meatloaf.
sentences.chinese: 我還嘗試做了你的卡津烘肉卷。

sentences.english: I love the delightful odour of freshly roasted coffee beans.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡新烘咖啡豆的清香氣味。

sentences.english: Cover with the lid and cook over high heat.
This delicate yellow-green Chardonnay has an aroma reminiscent of toasted bread and hot apple pie.
sentences.chinese: 色澤青黃，香味使人想起烘麪包及熟蘋果派。

sentences.english: I know you made meatloaf, Pop.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你做了烘肉卷，老爸。

sentences.english: Up to your elbows in barbecue sauce, meat hanging from your teeth, and grease in your hair.
sentences.chinese: 胳膊肘上都是燒烤醬，牙齒上有肉屑，頭髮油烘烘的。

definition: to dry over a fire/to bake
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on
